intro: Tecomaria schirensis, commonly known as the yellow flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has compound leaves with opposite leaflets and produces capsule fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in warm climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Tecomaria schirensis is relatively drought-tolerant and prefers well-drained soil.
